intro: Erigeron colomexicanus, commonly known as the Mexican fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer to early fall. Erigeron colomexicanus is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and low maintenance requirements.
